activities:
AssureTec's software, known as "AssureID", is used when an individual and/or customer needs to present their personal identity document to a immigration authority, retail supplier, transportation department or law enforcement agency.  Once processed, AssureID does not store personal information from the document bearer except under the following circumstances;

Sample data is the set of input data captured by a document reader or scanner, including document images, magnetic stripes, 2D barcodes, and contact or contactless chip data.  This information does contain personally identifiable information (PII) about the document bearer.
Sample data may also include other metadata including but not limited to:
•	Basic software information such as AssureID software and library versions
•	Device information, including device models, manufacturers, and serial numbers
•	Customer information, such as product license key and customer name
•	Results of the authentication process
The sample data for a single document is stored in a single, encrypted file to protect this sensitive information from unauthorized access.
When this information is provided, AssureTec stores this information in a secure database with controlled access and will only use this information to make improvements to the product or to test the product to verify its performance and accuracy.

AssureTec also collects data using The AssureID Customer Experience program which collects anonymous information about the usage and performance of AssureID Sentinel and transmit's this information to AssureTec where it is maintained in an internal database for use in developing and maintaining the product.  This information is used by the AssureTec development team to determine how well document classification, data capture, and authentication are working in the field by identifying trends using a large amount of data.  Participation in the program is optional. 

The document library development team uses customer experience data frequently for purposes such as:

•	Find problematic document types (i.e. those that have authentication high failure rates using recent software versions).
•	Fine-tune the authentication scoring model based on real world raw scores.
•	Find data parsing problems (magstripe/barcode) by looking at document types with data parsing failures.
•	Prioritize development by document type frequency (i.e. real world usage).

Customer experience data is truly anonymous, meaning that no identifying customer, computer, or document information is captured by default
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Sample data is the set of input data captured by a document reader or scanner, including document images, magnetic stripes, 2D barcodes, and contact or contactless chip data.  This information does contain personally identifiable information (PII) about the document bearer. This includes manually processed data.
